text: a story of kindness from the state of
Oklahoma after noticing that someone had
been rummaging through the rubbish
outside of her restaurant Ashley Jerone
decided to post a note on her dumpster
saying to the person getting through our
trash for their next meal you are a
human being and worth more than a meal
from a dumpster please come in during
operating hours for a classic peanut
butter and jelly sandwich fresh veggies
and water no charge no questions asked
well that message has now gone viral and
the restaurant owner Ashley has used the
attention to sort a crowd feeding
campaign with the hashtag share the nuts
I'm delighted to say that she joins us
here on global Ashley welcome to the
program a really really heartwarming
story this one tell me in a little more
detail why you decided to write that
note I decided to write that note
because I would want somebody to do the
same for me if I were out there looking
for food so I did what my parents taught
me to do and to invite somebody to my
table and to feed them am I right in
saying that part of what drove you to it
also was that you've been through some
pretty tough economic times yourself I
have I definitely have as a single
parent of two children and trying to go
to school and try to create something
for my daughter's I had to be on our
state assistance and sometimes at the
end of the month there just wasn't
enough money on the food stamps to to
last so we had to buy a loaf of bread or
peanut butter and jelly and boxed
macaroni and cheese and live off of that
for a week a week and a half and that's
probably why I decided to open the
peanut butter and jelly restaurant too
so you don't you left this note did the
person actually come in for that meal
out of respect for that person and my
heart for that person I would never say
whether that specific person came in or
not but through the generosity of
everyone who has been following the
story in supporting we are now able to
feed a few hundred people
which is amazing well I'm sorry no don't
be sorry I mean it's quite something to
have translated just from a single note
it going viral and actually now helping
hundreds of people i mean this this
hashtag this crowd feeding tell me more
about it because people can actually pay
for a meal then someone can come in
later who might need is it and pick it
up is that right yes if somebody cannot
afford their meal at that time they just
come in and take a tag off the wall and
they use that as their form of payment
because everyone else has paid for their
meal and the funds that are not used at
the end of the month we are actually
going to use that to mass feed the
homeless population here in our area and
hopefully grow on to even further and
hopefully will spill out into other
states and countries it would be so
amazing
